QUESTION 12) In early May 2014, the installation of the Hysy-981 oil drilling platform in the contested waters of the southern China Sea raised speculation about Chinese motivations. In the evaluation of several western observers, Beijing intended, with this gesture, to demonstrate that he can impose his control and dissuade other countries to follow with his claims of the right to exploit these waters, such as Vietnam and Philippines.
KLARE, M.T. The war for oil is thrown into the sea. Le Monde Diplomatique Brazil, Apr. 2015.
China's action regarding the situation described in the text shows a conflict that focuses on the:
A) Distribution of special economic zones.
B) Monopoly of extractive technological innovations.
C) dynamization of commercial activity.
D) jurisdiction of territorial sovereignty.
E) embargo on industrial production.
